document_data.name: Szuszalan
document_data.mainbody: '''Szuszalan''', known as '''the Warrior Maid''', was a veteran former [[adventurer]] and later advisor in the settlement of [[Goldenfields]] in the [[Dessarin Valley]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite polyhedron/58/The Everwinking Eye: Adventures in Maskyr's Eye|25}}{{Cite web enhancement/Environs of Waterdeep|9}}
document_data.History:
In her youth, she was a member of the [[Circle of Steel]], a famous all-female [[adventuring company]]. They dared to explore the ruins of [[Myth Drannor]] and, most impressively, lived to tell the tale. Szuszalan won her first handful of [[gold]] from the adventure.

She later founded another adventuring band, [[The Company of the Fiery Fane]].

In her time, Szuszalan slew an evil [[dragon]] and destroyed a vile [[lich]], and she won much treasure over her life. But eventually the gems lost their allure and the gold lost its gleam, and her victories grew dull. In time, she retired from the adventuring life.

In her old age, Szuszalan settled in the [[Chauntean]] abbey-town of Goldenfields. She wrote her biography, ''Walking on a Swordblade'', in the {{YearlinkName|1352}}. In it, she reflected that it was the companionship and sense of having what was truly hers that she remembered most fondly.

She still lived as of [[1372 DR]], though at her age few recognized her or linked her to her past exploits.
document_data.Relationships: She was both advisor and friend to [[Tolgar Anuvien]], the [[cleric]] of [[Chauntea]] and leader of Goldenfields.
document_data.Description: By [[1357 DR]], Szuszalan was elderly, and even considered a crone.
